lib.frc1747.motion_profile.generator._2d

Class Waypoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.frc1747.motion_profile.generator._2d.Waypoint

  • public class Waypoint
extends java.lang.Object
    Waypoints for use with QuinticBezeiers. Contains several features for easier GUI usage as well.
    Author:
    Tiger Huang

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double a_m
      The magnitude of the acceleration vector (ft/s^2)
      double a_t
      The direction of the acceleration vector(rad) Zero is in the direction of the velocity vector, and the angle increases counterclockwise.
      boolean reverse
      If the QuinticBezier immediately following this waypoint should be traveled in reverse or not.
      double v_m
      The magnitude of the velocity vector (ft/s)
      double v_t
      The direction of the velocity vector (rad) Zero is in the +y direction (forward), and the angle increases counterclockwise.
      double x
      The x position (ft)
      double y
      The y position (ft)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Waypoint()
      Creates a Waypoint with all zero parameters

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Shape getCurvatureShape()
      Gets a shape indicating the acceleration vector of the waypoint.
      Waypoint getInverse()
      Returns a waypoint that has the velocity component reversed so backwards QuinticBeziers can be generated.
      java.awt.Shape getPointShape()
      Gets the shape indicating the xy position of the waypoint.
      java.awt.Shape getTangentShape()
      Gets the shape indicating the velocity vector of the waypoint.
      void recalculateShapes(double scale, double widgetSize, double offx, double offy, double width, double height, double v_scale, double a_scale)
      Precomputes the shapes for more efficient drawing and manipulation.
      static java.awt.Polygon transformPolygon(double[] points, double scale, double offsetx, double offsety, double width, double height, double rotation, double magnitude)
      Creates a shape to use for drawing and manipulating from the parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • getInverse

        public Waypoint getInverse()
        Returns a waypoint that has the velocity component reversed so backwards QuinticBeziers can be generated.
        Returns:
        a waypoint with velocity and the reverse flag inverted

      • recalculateShapes

        public void recalculateShapes(double scale,
                              double widgetSize,
                              double offx,
                              double offy,
                              double width,
                              double height,
                              double v_scale,
                              double a_scale)
        Precomputes the shapes for more efficient drawing and manipulation.
        Parameters:
        scale - the scale of the distances being drawn on the window
        widgetSize - how large the shapes should be
        offx - the x offset at which to create the shapes
        offy - the y offset at which to create the shapes
        width - the width of the display window
        height - the height of the display window
        v_scale - how much to scale the velocity vector
        a_scale - how much to scale the acceleration vector

      • getPointShape

        public java.awt.Shape getPointShape()
        Gets the shape indicating the xy position of the waypoint.
        Returns:
        a shape indicating the xy position

      • getTangentShape

        public java.awt.Shape getTangentShape()
        Gets the shape indicating the velocity vector of the waypoint.
        Returns:
        a shape indicating the velocity vector

      • getCurvatureShape

        public java.awt.Shape getCurvatureShape()
        Gets a shape indicating the acceleration vector of the waypoint.
        Returns:
        a shape indicating the acceleration vector

      • transformPolygon

        public static java.awt.Polygon transformPolygon(double[] points,
                                                double scale,
                                                double offsetx,
                                                double offsety,
                                                double width,
                                                double height,
                                                double rotation,
                                                double magnitude)
        Creates a shape to use for drawing and manipulating from the parameters.
        Parameters:
        points - the points of the polygon
        The format is [x0, y0; x1, y1; ...]
        scale - the scale of the distances being drawn on the window
        offsetx - the x position of this polygon
        offsety - the y position of this polygon
        width - the width of the drawing window
        height - the height of the drawing window
        rotation - the direction of the vector being represented
        magnitude - the magnitude of the vector being represented
        Returns:
        a shape for drawing and manipulation
